meanings.definition: To convert into the metric system.
meanings.sent1: I will metricate the measurements from inches to centimeters.
meanings.sent2: It is important to metricate the weight in kilograms for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: Trying to metricate my grandma's recipes into grams was a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: She tried to metricate her emotions, but some things can't be quantified.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's goal was to metricate the data to simplify the analysis process.

meanings.definition: To measure or evaluate using the metric system.
meanings.sent1: We need to metricate the distance in meters for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist will metricate the medication dosage in milliliters.
meanings.sent3: I tried to metricate my friend's height in centimeters just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could not be metricated; it was beyond any scale of measurement.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to metricate the volume of the liquid in liters.
